content: Hello all my name is Joshua and i am new to this site i have never served but family has. I am a student and am working on a huge project that deals with war veterans and other major things in historyand am trying to contact any and all members that served during World War Iand World War II, or their families. you can send me a private message on here or email me at all communications with other members must be on the boards or through the profile email option. no phone numbers or other email addresses. and i will be happy to discuss the rest of the project with you. thanks for your time and thanks for the service you all have provided and continue to provide to this nation This message has been edited. Last edited by: OldArmyLove, Thu 26 March 2009 03:09 PM

content: quote: Originally posted by Wolfhound_1968: Sorry but you sound like so many inquires from the streets. I don’t think you’ll get the real McCoy to tell a stranger any war experiences until they know you and understand you’re sincere; maybe not even then. Try some wanta be that was never in war they’re usually full of shi!, I mean information about their heroics in battle. Good luck with your project. Exactly. My wife doesn't know a lot of thigns I've seen & done. I probably won't tell a new guy on the internet. It's not being humble or anything else. Combat is usually not heroic, IMO. It is doing the job to keep you and your buddy alive, even though you are scared spitless. That's not to say, I think you are lying, or don't want to help, but combat is a personal thing, and only a few people understand it. But, do stick around jalooby,and you will learn a lot, just by viewing the diffeent threads.

content: I always love these, "I've got a giant paper to do, but I want you to write it for me" posts. There are plenty of Veterans living around you. Go talk to them face to face, take notes, and do your own writing. Cutting and pasting from web sites and out of e-mails is not considered good research, or didn't your teacher tell you that? I taught English and History for 30 years, so I'd know - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: I always love these, "I've got a giant paper to do, but I want you to write it for me" posts. There are plenty of Veterans living around you. Go talk to them face to face, take notes, and do your own writing. Cutting and pasting from web sites and out of e-mails is not considered good research, or didn't your teacher tell you that? I taught English and History for 30 years, so I'd know - - Wandering and Wondering

content: this is not a college term paper but a project for the nation I am a member a a group called the history recording project that want to help preserve peoples real life history experiences weare doing a bunch of these on World War I, The Great Depression,World War II, Civil Rights Movement of the 1950s and 1960s, Vietnam Wa,Korean Conflict, and the list continues to grow. That is why we want you all to write it so it is truly your words and experience. then Private messageme on here and i will tellyou more as well as give anemail for better communication. thanks for any one that contacts us for more information or participates in the project.

reply: That is a good idea. there are a lot of people and groups that are trying to gain and preserve the memories of Veterans before they and their stories pass on. Our local town paper used to print such stories until it got gobbled up by the Pulitzer conglomerate and vanished - - Story seekers could have a central point to go to - - Wandering and Wondering
